note: The completed cohort fertility rate is typically given by the woman's birth year. In this chart, it has been shifted +30 years to see how the two measures compare at roughly the average age of mothers at childbirth.
title: Total fertility rate  vs cohort fertility rate vs tempo-adjusted total fertility rate
subtitle: Three measures of fertility rate are compared: the [total fertility rate](#dod:fertility-rate) (a summary metric based on birth rates across different age groups of women in one particular year); the [completed cohort fertility rate](#dod:cohort-fertility-rate) (the average number of children born to a woman by the end of her childbearing years); and the [tempo-adjusted total fertility rate](#dod:tempo-adjusted-tfr) (which aims to adjust for changes in the timing of childbearing).

display.name: Completed cohort fertility rate shifted +30 years
